intro: Microstylis mindorensis, commonly known as the Mindanao microstylis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wet, swampy areas and has slender, cylindrical stems. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, and it plays a role in the wetland ecosystems of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
